@graph.dct:title: Multidimensional Array Metadata Vocabulary
@graph.dct:description: A vocabulary for describing n-dimensional arrays with rich dimensional metadata, coordinate transforms, and categorical/temporal lookups
@graph.dct:creator: Multidimensional Array Working Group
@graph.rdfs:comment: Supports arrays with spatial, temporal, and categorical dimensions, external lookup tables, and pluggable transform vocabularies

@graph.rdfs:label: Multidimensional Array
@graph.rdfs:comment: An n-dimensional array with ordered dimensions forming an implicit coordinate space

@graph.rdfs:label: Coordinate Space
@graph.rdfs:comment: A mathematical container for coordinate systems, formed by a tuple of named dimensions

@graph.rdfs:label: Dimension
@graph.rdfs:comment: A single axis in a coordinate space with name, unit, and type properties

@graph.rdfs:label: Transform
@graph.rdfs:comment: A transformation between coordinate spaces, potentially using domain-specific vocabularies

@graph.rdfs:label: Category Scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: A collection of category definitions for categorical dimensions

@graph.rdfs:label: External Category Scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: A category scheme stored in an external table or file

@graph.rdfs:label: Event Scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: A collection of temporal event definitions

@graph.rdfs:label: External Event Scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: An event scheme stored in an external table or file

@graph.rdfs:label: Clock
@graph.rdfs:comment: A time reference system for interpreting timestamps

@graph.rdfs:label: Value Transform
@graph.rdfs:comment: Information about transformations applied to scalar array values

@graph.rdfs:label: External Table
@graph.rdfs:comment: Reference to an external data table (parquet, zarr, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: has dimension
@graph.rdfs:comment: Relates an array or coordinate space to its constituent dimensions

@graph.rdfs:label: has coordinate space
@graph.rdfs:comment: Relates an array to a named coordinate space

@graph.rdfs:label: has transform
@graph.rdfs:comment: Relates an array or coordinate space to a transformation

@graph.rdfs:label: transforms to
@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates the target coordinate space of a transformation

@graph.rdfs:label: has domain
@graph.rdfs:comment: The source/input coordinate space of a transformation

@graph.rdfs:label: has range
@graph.rdfs:comment: The target/output coordinate space of a transformation

@graph.rdfs:label: maps dimension
@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies how dimensions in the domain map to dimensions in the range

@graph.rdfs:label: has name
@graph.rdfs:comment: The identifier name of a dimension within its coordinate space

@graph.rdfs:label: has unit
@graph.rdfs:comment: The physical unit of measurement for a dimension

@graph.rdfs:label: has dimension type
@graph.rdfs:comment: The semantic type of a dimension (spatial, temporal, categorical, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: has category scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links a categorical dimension to its category definitions

@graph.rdfs:label: has event scheme
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links a temporal dimension to its event definitions

@graph.rdfs:label: has value transform
@graph.rdfs:comment: Relates an array to transformations applied to its scalar values

@graph.rdfs:label: references table
@graph.rdfs:comment: Points to an external table containing category or event data

@graph.rdfs:label: has lookup key
@graph.rdfs:comment: Field name used for joining with external table, or @row_index for positional lookup

@graph.rdfs:label: has format
@graph.rdfs:comment: File format of external table (parquet, zarr, csv, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: expected fields
@graph.rdfs:comment: List of expected column names in external table

@graph.rdfs:label: defines category
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links a category scheme to individual category definitions

@graph.rdfs:label: defines event
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links an event scheme to individual event definitions

@graph.rdfs:label: has index
@graph.rdfs:comment: The array index value that maps to a category or event

@graph.rdfs:label: has label
@graph.rdfs:comment: Human-readable label for a category or event

@graph.rdfs:label: has description
@graph.rdfs:comment: Longer description of a category, event, or other resource

@graph.rdfs:label: has timestamp
@graph.rdfs:comment: Temporal location of an event, potentially with clock reference

@graph.rdfs:label: has clock
@graph.rdfs:comment: References the clock/time system used to interpret a timestamp

@graph.rdfs:label: has time zone
@graph.rdfs:comment: Time zone information for a clock

@graph.rdfs:label: has calendar system
@graph.rdfs:comment: Calendar system used by a clock (Gregorian, Julian, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: has source
@graph.rdfs:comment: Source or origin of a clock (GPS, atomic, internal timer, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: has clock metadata
@graph.rdfs:comment: Additional metadata about a clock system

@graph.rdfs:label: has statistics
@graph.rdfs:comment: Statistical information about array values (min, max, mean, histogram arrays, etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: uses vocabulary
@graph.rdfs:comment: References the vocabulary/schema used for transform parameters

@graph.rdfs:label: has metadata
@graph.rdfs:comment: General property for attaching additional metadata to any resource

@graph.rdfs:label: url
@graph.rdfs:comment: URL or path to an external resource

@graph.rdfs:label: inherits metadata from
@graph.rdfs:comment: Indicates that basic array metadata is inherited from an existing format (e.g., ome-zarr, netcdf-cf, hdf5)

@graph.rdfs:label: extends with relations
@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies relational extensions beyond what the inherited metadata format provides

@graph.rdfs:label: references storage
@graph.rdfs:comment: Points to the actual array data storage location and format
